content.description: Fun techy climbing up face, the crux is at the 2nd bolt as you come into a slab with exciting edges and crimps.. forces some very thoughtful movement! The route continues from there up crimps in a slight overhang and onto juggy holds toward the top. Very fun route!
content.location: Left of The Shield, obvious bolted line

content.description: Classic! Technical movement to a powerful crux guarding the chains
content.location: Furthest down canyon route found. Lone bolted route above down pine tree to the right of a large arete.

content.description: Crack climb with crux near the bottom and blocky chimney climbing to the top
content.protection: Gear 1/4" to 3" and extendable draws. Anchor has nylon runner that may need replacement or chain.
content.location: To the left of jungle book on a wall with many crack systems. Starts in a vegetated right leaning seam then continues up a hand crack then to blocky chimney.

content.description:
Really unique route! This climbs the massive roof through the obvious weakness. Cool holds, to a wild crux through the roof then through the final bulge. It is highly recommended to use a long  draw in the second to last bolt to reduce rope drag. Also,

it is recommended to rappel the from the anchor to avoid lowering over an edge.
content.protection: 4 quick draws is all you will need, the rest are fixed chain draws for convenience of cleaning the roof. Like I said, use a very long draw for the second to last bolt.
content.location: Next bolted route to the left of Ronald McDonald House in the large cave.
To the left of diggler's razor

content.description: Tricksy. Start sitting in the back of the small cave and move through interesting  "calcited" chockstone holds. Pull over the lip and mantle the ledge.
content.location: Found in a cave in the cliff to the left of Ronald McDonald house.

content.description: Easy blocky terrain to a nice splitter off finger and hand crack. Clip a fixed pin and up the slabby arete to some bolts.
content.protection: Gear .5"-2", 1 fixed pin and a bolt. Chain anchor
content.location: The big ol' dihedral to the left of the schist cave.

content.description: Short but quite sustained. Steep awkward  arete climb.
content.location: The obvious arete left of The Sweathouse
